question: Born in November 1904 in ______ (Rajasthan) Panchanan Maheshwari rose to become one of the most distinguished botanists.

Dr W. Dudgeon was an American missionary ______.
Panchanan Maheshwari developed interest in Botany and especially ______.
His teacher once expressed that if his student progresses ahead of him, it will give him a great ______.

He worked on embryological aspects and popularised the use of embryological characters in ______.
He established the Department of Botany, University of Delhi as an important centre of research in embryology and ______ culture.
He emphasised the need for initiation of work on artificial culture of immature ______.
These days, tissue culture has become a ______ in science.
His work on test tube fertilisation and intra-ovarian ______ won worldwide acclaim.

He encouraged general education and made a significant contribution to ______ education.
